result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul L. Cardenas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: original filed in 14CF270

Defendant Paul L. Cardenas in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF270, 14CF309, 14CF450 and 15CF67.

3:20 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court did issue a body only warrant this morning but will now be vacated due to the voluntary appearance of the defendant.
Atty Knaapen states that there has been a change in the plea and this is stated on the record.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF270:
Count 1 - No contest
To be Amended to Misdemeanor
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No Contest
Count 4 - No Contest

14CF309:
Count 1 - No Contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

14CF450:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

15CF67:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification had been complied with but no victim's appear in Court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1, 3 & 4 on 14CF270 and Count 2 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 of 14CF309 and Counts 2 & 3 are DRI and on 14CF450 and 15CF67 all counts are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CF270:
Count 1 **Amended:
Impose/Stay Jail Sentence for 6 months **consecutive to 14CF309 file
Placed on 24 months probation to run concurrent to 14CF309 and if revoked will have to serve 6 months and the first 90 days in jail and the remaining 90 days on home monitor to be determined by the jail and risk assessment with huber priveleges for employment or counseling
Comply with conditions of Probation as set forth in the 14CF309 file
Pay Fine of $300 plus Costs - victim witness surcharge, DNA Surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge
**Cash bond on deposit to be applied to fine/costs 

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay Jail Sentence of  6 months - Concurrent to 6 months in Count 1 but consecutive to 90 days in14CF309
Huber priveleges as approved by the jail and risk assessment only if probation is revoked and first 90 days in jail and the remaining 90 days on home monitor for employment and counseling
Placed on 24 months Probation to run Concurrent 
Pay costs - victim witness surcharge, DNA Surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge 
Comply with conditions as set forth in 14CF309 

Count 4 -
30 days jail Imposed/Stayed to run Concurrent to Count 1 & 3 - all served in jail
**Huber for employment and counseling if probation revoked and approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Placed on 24 months probation to run Concurrent 
Pay costs - victim witness surcharge, DNA Surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge 
Comply with conditions in 14CF309 file
**Bond monies in other cases can be applied to the fine/costs 

14CF309:
Count 1 - 
90 day jail sentence - Imposed/Stayed
**Huber priveleges for employment/counseling if probation revoked but if Domestic Incident will have to spend all 90 days in jail 
Placed on 24 months probation
Conditions of Probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and compliance.
Obtain and Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent and any assessments as recommended by the agent
Pay restitution of $175.00
Pay costs - victim witness surcharge, DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge
14 days pre-trial incarceration credit 
**Cash bond on deposit to be applied to restitution first and then court costs
**PROBATION CAN BE TRANSFERRED TO WOOD COUNTY 

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

14CF450:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

15CF67:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Body Only

Defendant Paul L. Cardenas NOT in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF270, 14CF309, 14CF450 and 15CF67. 

9:31 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court makes statements that this case had been schedued for a Jury Trial 01/13/16 and then changed to a Plea Hearing for today.
Court questions Atty Wallace as to if he had heard from his client.
Atty Wallace has not heard from him.
Court will withhold any findings on bond forfeiture's at this time.

BY THE COURT:
Warrants issued on all cases.
Body only.

Defendant Paul L. Cardenas in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF270, 14CF309, 14CF450 and 15CF67.

8:59 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Atty Knaapen states the plea agreement on the record.
Atty Wallace has a Plea Questionnaire completed but defendant unwilling to provide a plea at this time.
Jury Trial is set  and will be held in January 2016.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.
Status conference at 01-13-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Paul L. Cardenas in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:04 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
State addresses the agreement.

14CF-270 Defendant will plead to Count 1. Cts 2, 3, 4 dismissed and read in

14CF-309: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Cts 2,3 dismissed and read in

14CF-450: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Ct 2 dismissed and read in

15CF-67: Dismissed and read in

Atty Wallace addresses the Court, Defendant requests the detective present.

Court will not adjourn this anymore, will set this for a jury trial, oldest case will be set for jury trial, rest will be set for a status conference at the same date/time.


BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond will be ordered continued.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing at 12-01-2015 10:15 am

Defendant Paul L. Cardenas in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-450, 15CF-67, 14CF-270 and 14CF-309.

2:24 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen states that parties were prepared to enter a plea and sentencing but information was presented to the State today that the State will look into it, requests a status conference.
Parties expect to have a plea hearing in the end.

  Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-28-2015 02:15 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-04-2015 10:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-04-2015 10:00 am

All files heard: 14CF270, 14CF309, 14CF450, 15CF67

11:43 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Atty Wallace indicates they would like to enter his pleas after his final divorce date in August. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
